intro: Sida conferta, commonly known as silky sida, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States and parts of Mexico. It is a herbaceous annual or perennial plant characterized by its small, white to pale pink flowers and fuzzy, hairy leaves. The plant typically grows in disturbed soils and is often found in open fields, roadsides, and along stream banks. Its leaves are covered in fine, silky hairs, which give it a distinctive appearance. Sida conferta is part of the Malvaceae family, which includes other plants like cotton and hibiscus.
